targets.query:
from(bucket: "nande")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "smartctl")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "health")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["serial"] == "{SERIAL_DRIVE_ID}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> last()
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description: The amount of the smart attributes where the current value reached the threshold and the prefailure flag is enabled

targets.query:
from(bucket: "nande")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "smartctl")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "prefailure_count")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["serial"] == "{SERIAL_DRIVE_ID}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: v.windowPeriod, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> last()
  |> yield(name: "mean")

panels.description: This value does not represent the number of read errors instead some vendor specific value. But if the value raises fast or has spikes then it could indicate a drive issue

targets.query:
from(bucket: "nande")
  |> range(start: v.timeRangeStart, stop: v.timeRangeStop)
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_measurement"] == "smartctl")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["_field"] == "raw_read_error_rate")
  |> filter(fn: (r) => r["serial"] == "{SERIAL_DRIVE_ID}")
  |> aggregateWindow(every: 30s, fn: mean, createEmpty: false)
  |> yield(name: "mean")
